result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brady Sand Coulson

records.addlTxt: Plea hearing on December 6, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on August 31, 2022 at 11:00 am.
filed by ADA Kaley Walker. eif
Pre-trial conference on July 27, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

09:40 AM Defendant Brady Sand Coulson in Court with Attorney Philip A. Helgeson.  ADA Kaley Walker appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court confirms receipt of Information.  Advises of charges and possible penalties.  Further reading waived.  Atty. Helgeson enters NG pleas.  Bond continues.  Court confirms Defendant's address/phone.  Adjourned at 9:42 AM

09:31 AM Defendant Brady Sand Coulson in Court with Attorney Philip A. Helgeson.  ADA Kaley Walker appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Includes Preliminary Hearing on 22CF122 and PTC on  21CF254.  ADA Walker requests judicial notice of Bail/Bond in 21CF254, Court takes judicial notice.  S/T PC Deputy Jeremy Lewis.  Direct by ADA Walker.  Defendant identified.  Cross by Atty. Helgeson.  Officer released.  Atty. Helgeson declines argument.  State requests Court find probable cause and bind Defendant over for trial.   Court makes findings; finds probable cause that a felony was committed and binds Defendant over for further proceedings.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Cover letter with Notice of Retainer and Discovery Demand
Court finds Defendant freely, intelligently, knowingly, and understandingly made and waives constitutional right to those time requirements.
records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on July 13, 2022 at 09:30 am.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY
NO POSSESSION OR CONSUMPTION OF ALCOHOL
NO ENTRY INTO BARS, TAVERNS, OR LIQUOR STORES

03:05 PM Defendant Brady Sand Coulson appears via videoconferencing from PCJ with Attorney Derek W Sanders via phone.  Defendant Brady Sand Coulson in custody.  ADA Kaley Walker appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court confirms Defendant received copy of Complaint.  Court informs Defendant of charges and possible penalties.  Further reading waived.  Court advises Defendant of rights.  State requests $500.00 cash bond with conditions of AS, NPOCA and NEBTLS.  States argument noting 21CF254 and treatment of law enforcement.  Atty. Sanders objects to cash bond, requests signature bond or lower cash.  Court questions work and notes no missed appearances in 21CF254.  Court orders $10,000 signature bond w/conditions as requested.  Court notes 21CF254 set for PTC on 07/13 at 9:30 a.m.  Atty. Helgeson's office obtained for scheduling.  Court confirms Defendant's address, phone and dob.  Non-military.  Adjourned at 3:21 PM   
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 09:30 am.
